title._content: [Private Henry McCollum of Company B, 78th Pennsylvania Infantry Regiment and three unidentified soldiers in 78th Pennsylvania Infantry uniforms at Point Lookout, Tennessee] (LOC)

description._content: Linn, Royan M.,, photographer. [Private Henry McCollum of Company B, 78th Pennsylvania Infantry Regiment and three unidentified soldiers in 78th Pennsylvania Infantry uniforms at Point Lookout, Tennessee] [1863?] 1 photograph : quarter-plate tintype ; 10.8 x 9.3 cm (case) Notes: Title devised by Library staff. Case: Leather; central floral motif surrounded by scrolls design. Photo shows soldiers who posed for the Linns, who left Ohio to photograph the Army of the Cumberland. In late 1863, after the battles of Lookout Mountain and Missionary Ridge, the pair set up a studio near Point Lookout. Here they photographed the western Union armies as they concentrated for an advance on Atlanta. (Source: Matthew R. Gross and Elizabeth T. Lewin, 2010) Deposit; Tom Liljenquist; 2011; (D 062). Forms part of: Liljenquist Family Collection of Civil War Photographs (Library of Congress). Subjects: McCollum, Henry,--d. 1864. United States.--Army.--Pennsylvania Infantry Regiment, 78th (1861-1865)--People--Tennessee--Lookout Mountain. Military uniforms--Union--1860-1870. Soldiers--Union--Tennessee--Lookout Mountain--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Military personnel--Union--Tennessee--Lookout Mountain. Format: Portrait photographs--1860-1870. Tintypes--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: Ambrotype/Tintype filing series (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2010650518 Liljenquist Family collection (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2010650519 More information about this collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.lilj Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.31696 Call Number: AMB/TIN no. 2750
